divs: sighting detailson tue 07\28\09 ~ 22:17 a bright red orb similar in size to saturn first quickly moved from wsw (elv 50 deg) to ene (elv 140 deg) slowed, and then remained ene being obstructed by clouds or turning "on and off" until 22:27. at times the orb's glowing red steady color seemed to brighten but did not strobe or flash at all while moving. present during at least part of the viewing during a cloudy night were two adults and four children in front of our melvindale, mi house. spaceweather.com indicated: viewing: melvindale, michig (42.3 lat., -83.2 long.) all times displayed are local. you have no flybys. please check again next week! i took some digital photos and will download later to my pc.
trends: There have been 6 other sightings in Melvindale
There were no other sightings in Melvindale on or around July 28th 2009
Summary: A bright red orb the size of saturn moved from WSW (ELV 50 deg) to ENE (ELV 140 deg) witnessed by four + people.
